Sports & Athletics.name: Alamodome Aces & Ice Kings
Sports & Athletics.description: Test your knowledge of various sports, from the gridiron to the ice rink. This quiz covers a range of questions about professional teams, rules, and legendary moments in sports history. Are you a true sports aficionado?

questions.text: In golf, what is one stroke over par called?
questions.hint: This term is used when a golfer takes one more shot than the expected score for a hole.

questions.text: What professional sports team plays its home games in the Alamodome?
questions.hint: This NBA team is based in a Texas city famous for the Alamo.

questions.text: In ice hockey, which of the following is not a penalty?
questions.hint: Penalties in hockey involve physical infractions, not artistic maneuvers.

questions.text: In American football, how many points is a touchdown worth?
questions.hint: This is the primary scoring play, worth more than a field goal but less than with an extra point.

questions.text: How many periods are there in an ice hockey game?
questions.hint: A standard game is divided into equal segments, excluding overtime.

questions.text: Whom did Billie Jean King defeat in the famous 'Battle of the Sexes' tennis match?
questions.hint: This former male champion was challenged by King in a 1973 publicity stunt.

questions.text: In what sport do athletes compete for the Walker Cup?
questions.hint: This sport involves international amateur competition on manicured courses.

questions.text: What sport is known as 'The Sport of Kings'?
questions.hint: This sport involves thoroughbreds and has a long history with royalty.

Sports & Athletics.name: Strike Zone & Diamond Dreams
Sports & Athletics.description: From the lanes to the ballpark, this quiz dives into the world of bowling and baseball.  Challenge your understanding of rules, terminology, and iconic moments in these beloved American pastimes. Can you knock it out of the park?

questions.text: What do you call three consecutive strikes in bowling?
questions.hint: This term is named after a bird associated with Thanksgiving.

questions.text: How many innings are there in a regular Major League Baseball game?
questions.hint: This number allows each team multiple opportunities to bat and field.

questions.text: In horse racing, what is the term for a wager on the 1st, 2nd and 3rd place finishers in a specific race?
questions.hint: This bet requires predicting the top three horses in exact order.

Sports & Athletics.name: Triple Crown & Pigskin Legends
Sports & Athletics.description: Delve into the history and lore of horse racing and American football. This quiz explores legendary figures, record-breaking moments, and the unique traditions that make these sports so captivating.  Do you have what it takes to be a champion?

questions.text: In 1978, who became the youngest jockey ever to win horse racing's triple crown?
questions.hint: This jockey's name is associated with a common first name and a youthful achievement.

questions.text: Which of these is referred to as a 'pigskin'?
questions.hint: This sport’s ball was historically made from animal hide, earning the nickname.

questions.text: What is the oldest continuously run sporting event in the United States?
questions.hint: This horse race is known as 'The Run for the Roses.'

questions.text: In baseball, how many balls make a walk?
questions.hint: This number of pitches outside the strike zone grants the batter a free base.

questions.text: Which of these candy bars was named for a baseball player?
questions.hint: This candy’s name is linked to a legendary slugger from the early 20th century.

questions.text: What football player was known as 'The Galloping Ghost'?
questions.hint: This early NFL star played for the Chicago Bears and was a college legend.

questions.text: In bowling, how many pins must you knock down to get a strike?
questions.hint: A strike requires clearing the entire set of pins in one roll.

questions.text: What sporting event is held annually on Memorial Day weekend?
questions.hint: This auto race is one of the oldest and most prestigious in the U.S.

Sports & Athletics.name: Global Game & Ice Arena
Sports & Athletics.description: Test your knowledge of international sports and the thrill of the ice rink. This quiz covers soccer, hockey, and Olympic moments, challenging your understanding of rules, strategies, and legendary athletes. Are you ready to score big?

questions.text: Before he went into coaching, Phil Jackson played for which of the following NBA teams?
questions.hint: This team is based in a major East Coast city known for its basketball history.

questions.text: In soccer, which player is allowed to use his or her hands in the field of play?
questions.hint: This player is responsible for protecting the goal from incoming shots.

questions.text: In what year did the United States last win an Olympic gold medal in men's ice hockey?
questions.hint: This victory, known as the 'Miracle on Ice,' occurred during the Cold War.
